page.title: 08Parades and Processions
page.content: In Haslingden there is an annual{St. {Georges Day Parade.}This is held on April 23rd. or the Sunday immediately preceeding it.The procession involves scouts, cubs, the Boys Brigade, the Girls Brigade, Girl Guides, Brownies and Rangers.The procession travels slowly through most of the town headed by a band. A short church service follows. On Remembrance Sunday a service of remembrance is held in the Memorial Gardens. As well as local childrens organisations the British Legion is also involved. A third religious celebration is{ {Walking Day.}This is a procession of people from the local churches through the town to St. James Church. There are many floats and dancers.
